That's not very optimal. Wizards gain a feat every 3 levels after 20, so 26 and 28 are almost the same except for 2 more caster levels (meh). I'd either go Wizard 29 / PM 10 / SD 1 and live without Tumble AC for a very long time (if you can handle it) or Wizard 26 PM 10 SD 4 and have 4 skill dumps (2 pre-and 2 epic ones or 1 pre-epic and 3 epic ones). The only downside is spending your feats on Dodge and Mobility as a requirement to SD, but HiPS is always nice.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Why not build a Wizard35/ PM1/ SD4!

You take PM 1 at level 7 for skilldumps to qualify for SD. Then SD 1 at level 8 for HIPS asap and 3 more SD levels at lvl 17, 27 and 37(or later) for skilldumps.
You get a high level mage with good spell penetration and focus on intelligence for high spell DC. The mage has high stealth ranks and can HIPS.
You max the stealth skills and maybe even take skill focus/ epic skill focus to get a high enough modified rank. Taking tumble beyond 5 ranks is optional, but recommended if AC is important for your play style.
There are several classes with class skills that will help qualify for SD. PM is one of them with hide and move silently. Tumble must be x-classed, but then again PM1 gives +2 AC. As long as you only take 1 PM level pre epic, you get the same number of spellslots level by level as would a pure wizard.
Wizards can afford to spend feats for SD and stealth since they get meta magical bonus feats.
